subject: Education
title: Interleaving: Mix It Up to Remember More
description: A micro-lesson that makes Interleaving: Mix It Up to Remember More usable.

hook.text: Baseball players who practice fastballs-then-curves do worse than those who mix pitch types randomly.

buildup.text: Blocked practice (AAABBBCCC) feels smoother; interleaved practice (ABCBACBCA) feels harder.

discovery.text: Interleaving forces the brain to discriminate between concepts, building deeper understanding.

twist.text: Students consistently rate interleaving as less effectiveâ€”even as they score higher.

climax.text: Math students who interleave problem types score 43% higher on delayed tests.

punchline.text: Confusion during practice becomes clarity during performance.

quiz.question: Why does interleaving improve learning despite feeling harder?
options: It forces the brain to discriminate between concepts, building deeper understanding
It reduces total study time needed
It activates a special 'interleaving region' of the brain
